content:
Thunderbird is a pr0ogram running on your computer. Not a web site. So really I have no idea what you even mean by a blank page. You install it, set it up with your mail account details and when you open it , it reaches out to your mail provider and gets your mail.

What is this blank screen?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I'm well aware of that - there's no need to sound so condescending. I was looking for a way to open without the "Choose what to set up" and "Import From another program" info - both of which are quite valid and useful, but not necessary to show every time the program is opened. If it's not possible, why not just say so, instead of just assuming that the user is an idiot?
creator: nmrn2012

content: Go to Help > Troubleshooting Information > Application Basics > Profiles > about:profiles. Launch the others one at a time and restart TB. If they all give the setup screen, try creating a new profile (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles).
creator: siffemoz

content: Thanks for your very helpful suggestion Ed. I have several profiles in the account and after the rude and unhelpful response from Matt I tried a couple of things and found one way to get TB to open how I want was simply to leave a profile message screen open when I closed the app. That way it reopens there and I can just switch to the one I want, which is pretty close to the way WLM works. That's probably the same, or at least similar, to your suggestion and I'll have a look at that later tonight - it's been a long day :-) Appreciate your help.
creator: nmrn2012

content: Perhaps if you walk us through what you are doing someone can guess as to what he issue is, but if it affects webmail as well as mail clients it is probably third party software like an antivirus, or it could be your images. I know Apple images do not go well in emails as they use an Apple proprietary file format by default that blurs image and movie into a single file. These tend to appear in emails as a blank placeholder, often in a frame.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:

it would be useful if you could post a link to the article which contains that data.

The 'Use System timezone' settings to do with calendar are here: Settings > Calendar
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
What have you got set up on computer for 'Timezone' ?

Date and Time settings for Thunderbird emails

Settings > General Scroll down to 'Language & Appearance' section Under sub section 'Date and Time Formatting'

Thunderbird uses the computer date time and timezone settings.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :Trying to enable calandar on thunderbird.

Thunderbird has a built in Calendar which it auto calls 'Home'. It is already created. There is an icon shortcut to the 'Calendar' via the left vertical 'Spaces Toolbar' or use 'Alt 3'

You can also access it via the 'Menu Bar' Toolbar

  • 'Events and Tasks'
  • Select 'Calendar' and it opens in a new tab.

To enable the 'Menu Bar' toolbar - I would do this anyway as it has a load of easy to find menu items.

  • Menu app (3 lines) > 'View' > 'Toolbars' > select 'Menu Bar'

Settings > Calendar This is where all the default Calendar settings are located.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
If you are trying to create a new calendar (in addition to the default) eg: you want to synchronise with a gmail/google calendar: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-lightning-google-calendar

You can also easily do this from the 'Calendar' view Open 'Calendar' Bottom of left pane is a 'New Calendar' link - follow instructions.
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: @next

content:
If you use any program that uses 'localhost' such as 'Apache' 'Xampp' then you need to switch it off whilst setting up 'Oauth' token. Some people use programs to manage websites and they use 'localhost'.

If you use a VPN then gmail will not like it because it looks like you are hacker, gmail expects the IP of your computer, so you need to switch off VPN or create a split tunnelling and set it up to allow Thunderbird to use it.

If you have previously set up a gmail account and it's now asking for password etc - first check you have got no VPN operating and thet your Firewall has Thunderbird as an allowed program.

Have you set up Thunderbird to allow cookies ?

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • WEb Content
  • Select 'Accept cookies from sites'
  • Accept third party cookies: 'Always'
  • Click on 'Exceptions' :
  • set up: https://accounts.google.com' as 'Allow'
  • Click on 'Save Changes'


If you previously set it up but need to reset passwords, oauth token etc. In addition to all above - clear/remove all stored password for the account.

  • Settings > Privacy & SEcurity'
  • Passwords section
  • Click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • Remove all passwords that you see for that gmail account. Whether they are 'mailbox://account..' or 'Imap://account...' or 'Smtp://account...' or oauth://account...'

So there's nothing stored.

then restart Thunderbird
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hai quindi verificati di avere spazio sia sul server che sul tuo disco locale? Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Si è stata modificata la gestione dei percorsi di rete per ragioni di sicurezza. Qui i dettagli -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79602.0

content:
I am unclear on what you are asking. Since you are using IMAP, my suggested steps are:

  1. click file/offline/download <== this is only to ensure that all message content and headers are on PC
  2. after this, all messages are on PC .
  3. install the importexport NG addon if not already done
  4. highlight Local Folders, rightclick and select importexport menu to import mbox, and then locate and select the inbox folder from the profile at the imapmail<accountname> folder
creator: davidsk

content: Error 553 usually indicates a blocked email account or possibly a misdefined account setup (such as a discrepancy between sending email account and SMTP email account.
creator: davidsk
